p:
In the full models, colonies aggregated in areas with high dispersal frequency because both attractiveness and dispersal frequency are proportional to the same function

h ( x , y )
(Fig. 1e). Unlike the two previous models, the lengths of the establishment phases decreased with an increase in the spatial factor (Figs. 1f and 2b, blue circles). In the full models, the periods of the establishment phases varied among realizations and were smaller than those of the source-mediated-dispersal models (Fig. 2b, blue circles). In the full model the establishment and expansion phases responded similarly to the destination-mediated-dispersal models. Larger values of the spatial factor resulted in longer expansion and naturalization phases (Fig. 2c,d, blue circles). Thus, a major characteristic of the full models is a rapid population growth in a heterogeneous landscape just after the invasion.
